abstract: Movies shot in 3-D are expensive, computational nightmares. And nobody in the audience looks good in those glasses. Jeffrey Katzenberg, the head of DreamWorks Animation, is still committed. DreamWorks has done all of its films in a 3-D version since 2009. He says the technology will improve. So will moving past the days of "Evil Bong 3-D."

headline.main: Predicting the Rise and Rise of 3-D
